text:
Hey, guys. I'm at Disney's
Animal Kingdom,

and I'm going to get
an inside look

at how they do the Festival
Of The Lion King.
Let's check it out.

The Festival Of The Lion King
is where they bring songs

and scenes from
the movie to life.

It's the 25th anniversary
of the movie,
so it's a huge celebration.
Hey, Mallory.

It's so nice to meet you.
I'm going to go change,

and then I want
to show you all around.

We have dancers, acrobats,
singers, costumers,

and technicians
to make the show happen

- eight or nine times a day. 
- Wow.

This is our
huge costuming room.

So much detail
goes into every piece.

All of the animals
are represented.
You're a giraffe!

Mallory:
The monkeys were amazing.
How much do they practice?

Rachael: They have
a whole training facility.
It's so fun to watch them.

Here we have
one of our huge floats

our amazing puppeteers
bring to life.

- This is so cool.
- ( trumpets )
That was incredible.
I had no idea how much goes on
to make this amazing show.
